Title: Explore if Google Attachments can send updated information to Tracker
Description: Like if the file name changes or size etc

Title: Handle attachment parameter in comment create and update commands on the server
Labels: command town, github attachments, heidmo accept
Description:
### [PR 1088](https://github.com/pivotaltracker/tracker/pull/1088)

CommentCreate & CommentUpdate command can accept a "attachments" field. The `Attachments` field and the `file/google_attachments` fields are mutually exclusive and will error if both types are in the parameters.

The parameters for attachments should be backwards compatible. However, we do not need forward compatibility because we will switch to results processing before we start sending new parameters from stories view (#138675351, #137978163).

Title: Project color not retained after reload if changed in project or workspace edit (on www) or just workspace (on ondeck)
Description:
1. Got to a project on www
2. Change its color
3. reload the page- old color is back
4. Got to a workspace on on deck
5. Click manage workspace icon (tooltip says project count not manage Workspace - may be hard for users to find BTW. Hopefully they'll guess which item under Settings allows colors to be changed)
6. Click a color to change it.
7. It seems to change in sidebar but does not change in workspace. 
8. Reload page - old color back in sidebar and remains in workspace panels.

Title: A warning dialog appears if attempting to download an attachment with an unknown filetype.
Description:
### [PR 1179](https://github.com/pivotaltracker/tracker/pull/1179)

~~[PR 1067](https://github.com/pivotaltracker/tracker/pull/1067)~~

This behavior reproduces using the new comment styling.

1.  Add a comment with an attachment that is an unknown type.  (See attached.)
2.  Edit the comment.
3.  Click the attachment. (Click any attachment with an unknown file type - it is not limited to attachments in the comment under edit.)

Expected:  If it works like the existing behavior, it downloads.
Actual:  A navigation warning appears (see attached.)

Title: Creating a story with a google attachment fails
Description:
### [PR 1234](https://github.com/pivotaltracker/tracker/pull/1234)

See [Splunk Logs](https://pivotal.splunkcloud.com/en-US/app/search/search?q=search%20*%20google_attachmentundefined&display.page.search.mode=smart&dispatch.sample_ratio=1&earliest=-24h%40h&latest=now&display.prefs.events.offset=0&sid=1489188761.1959&display.prefs.events.count=50)

Expected:

It gets a 500 error

Description:
### [PR 1182](https://github.com/pivotaltracker/tracker/pull/1182)

**Goals:**
* Fix #139482005 this data loss issue where the pending description is clobbered 
* Remove another backbone view

**~~Non~~Goal**

**Example**
1. See story above
2. Happy path case - User edits the description and presses done to save and submit request to server.

Title: Description edits can be lost while using projector mode in a workspace.
Description:
When using projector mode in a workspace - if you edit and /or add a description, then add a comment (or similar action), then click "Close" - the description changes are not autosaved.

To dup:

1. While in a workspace, change your story density mode to Projector Mode.
2. Double click a story to edit it (it will go to single story mode)
3. Edit the description but don't click Done
4. **Add a comment, task or label**
5. Click Close
6. **Expected** - description edits are saved
7. **Actual** - description edits are lost


**NOTE** The issue only happens to the left most panel, so if you have multiple project panels open, it only occurs to the one closest to the sidebar. If you only have one panel open, it will also dup. 

Additional notes: 

- I tested this with projector mode in a single project - it worked fine.
- I tested this with normal density mode in a workspace - it works fine

Title: Slow project loading due to file attachment loader
Description:
### [PR 1255](https://github.com/pivotaltracker/tracker/pull/1255)

Project [Nexia Home](https://www.pivotaltracker.com/n/projects/106730) is very slow to load (initially 30+ seconds, reduced to 15+ after advising to reduce done stories loaded).

[NewRelic information](https://rpm.newrelic.com/accounts/973/applications/26797379/transactions#id=5b22436f6e74726f6c6c65722f73657276696365732f76352f6361636865645f70726f6a656374732f73686f77222c22225d&app_trace_id=ee1a7691-08cf-11e7-a5be-f8bc124256a0_9404_13456) showing a file attachment loading performance issue.

**User report:**

What change caused the initial load to be sooooo slow?

Opening one of our projects takes 20-30 seconds now..

Title: Clicking a link or trying to select text in the description opens edit view
Description:
### [PR 1266](https://github.com/pivotaltracker/tracker/pull/1266)

1.  Try to select text in a description by dragging.

Expected:  The text becomes selected.
Actual:  Edit mode opens.


1.  Click a link inside of the description.

Expected:  The link opens in a new tab.
Actual:  The link opens in a new tab, but tabbing back to the story reveals the description is in edit view

Title: When editing the description field, the wrong emoji font family is being used
Description:
This reproduces on demo.
1.  Edit the description field.
2.  See the computed font family.
Expected:  The EmojiFontFace family is used.
Actual:  AppleEmoji,SegoeUIEmoji,EmojiOne are used.

Possibly a related issue - if not, I will put a separate bug but Heidmo thought might be related:
1. Change density to projector mode
2. Open a story in single story view. If it already has a description, the text is appropriately huge.
3. Edit the description. 
Expected: Any text already there, or any text you type, remains huge. This is prod behavior.
Actual: In edit mode, the text is small, as if it were normal density. Screenshots attached of prod and demo behavior.

Title: CMD+S and CMD+Enter do not save changes on reactified description
Description:
1.  Edit the description of a story.
2.  Press CMD+S or CMD+Enter.

Expected:  The story is collapsed and the changes are saved.
Actual:  The description leaves its draft state, however the changes are not saved and the story is not collapsed.

Title: Commit messages can cause a horizontal scrollbar to appear
Description:
### [PR 1278](https://github.com/pivotaltracker/tracker/pull/1278)

You can see this behavior in the following story https://ondeck.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140338779

1.  Add a commit with a long string that contains no spaces.

Expected:  Needs design.  We previously had a horizontal scrollbar appear much like in a code block.
Actual:  The text runs off the panel causing a horizontal scrollbar to appear.  See the attached image.

Title: explore editing descriptions to discover any regression failures
Labels: charter, convert backbone views to react
Description: https://ondeck.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/140775189 is reactifying edit description. This is the charter to explore it for regressions.

Title: Stories with a lot of activity causing typing to appear very slowly
Description:
### [PR 1298](https://github.com/pivotaltracker/tracker/pull/1298)

This requires a story with many comments.  You can import the attached .csv to create a story that exhibits this behavior.

1.  Expand the story with many comments.  
2.  Begin typing in the comments field.

Expected:  Keystrokes are added immediately.
Actual:  Adding text is incredibly slow.

Appears to happen only with new comment styling, though with old comment styling, we feel like we can detect a tiny amount of slowness. 

Per Ben, turning on the react dev tool thingie shows too many things re-rendering. 

Branch: `142273301-activity-performance`

Title: Story flyovers on story links don't work in single story view
Labels: production, state previews on story links
Description:
Steps one www or on deck:

1. Create a story, add a comment with a link to another story
2. Open that story in single story view (either via URL or by clicking the arrow button in the expanded story)
3. Hover over the link

Expected: Flyover with details of the linked story (the same as yours still get when in an expanded story in a panel

Actual: Nada

This broke and was fixed previously: https://ondeck.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/127820687

Here's a story that demo's problem:
www https://www.pivotaltracker.com/n/projects/808147/stories/140895959
on deck https://ondeck.pivotaltracker.com/n/projects/808147/stories/140895959

Title: result_processor sanity checks
Description:
While trying to diagnose a bug, noticed two things:

1) `filterUnprocessableResults` should probably only have a whitelist, ie throw on unrecognized result types.
2) `sortResults` does not check for unrecognized result types if there is only one result, because the check happens in the sort comparison, and the sort comparison never fires if there is only one item in the array.

Fix both of these.

Title: Verify that retrying commands in the PullRequest service actually decreases webhook failures
Description: We implemented retry logic in the PR service as part of #150498907. Let's see if it actually decreases webhook failures.
